kac: Ndai langu si i?
translation: What is this thing?

kac: N re.
translation: You go.

kac: Dai gaw lamung si re.
translation: This house is good.

kac: Ndai gaw hpa rai?
translation: Where is this?

kac: Dai gaw ma-un si re.
translation: This house is big.

kac: Ma La, kaja ai i?
translation: Mr. La, are you reading a book?

kac: Kaja ai.
translation: The dog barks.

kac: Ma Lu gaw?
translation: Where is Ma Lu?

kac: Ngai ya gat sa na.
eng: I am going to the market now.
translation: I will go eat now.

kac: Hkan na i?
translation: Where are you?

kac: Um, hkan na.
translation: Isn't it?

kac: Hpa baw mari na rai?
eng: What are you going to buy?
translation: Do you want to eat rice?

kac: Ngai kanau na labu sa mari na.
eng: I am going to buy a longyi for my little sister.
translation: I will buy a book again tomorrow.

kac: Ma La, hpa sha na rai?
eng: Ma La, what are you going to eat?
translation: Is Ma La at home?

kac: Ngai wa shan shat mai sha na.
eng: I will eat a side dish with pork.
translation: I like to study language every day.

kac: Ma Lu, nang ma wa shan sha na i?
eng: Ma Lu, are you also going to eat pork?
translation: Is this because Lu is not happy with you?

kac: N sha ai.
translation: You like it.

kac: Ngai wa shan shat mai n ra ai.
eng: I don't like a side dish with pork.
translation: I brought four more books.

kac: Hpa shat mai ra ai rai?
eng: What side dish do you need?
translation: Has the food finished yet?

kac: U shan shat mai ra ai.
eng: I will have a side dish with chicken.
translation: The person can carry a big stone.

kac: Ma La, shat sha ngut sai i?
translation: Ma La, have you finished reading the three books?

kac: Sha ngut sai.
translation: There are three pieces of meat.

kac: N sha shi ai.
translation: I am eating food.

kac: Ngai kaw si taw sai.
translation: I am the one with the book.

kac: Dai hku nga, ngai shat jam jaw sha na yaw.
eng: In that case, I will treat you shat jam.
translation: This time, I will try to reach there if possible.

kac: Kaja i?
translation: How are you?

kac: Gara kaw ma?
translation: How are you?

kac: Manang na Jinghpaw shat seng kaw re.
eng: It is at my friend's Jinghpaw restaurant.
translation: They speak the Jinghpaw language very well.

kac: Grai sha mu ai.
translation: The cow eats the grass.

kac: Gai, hkan nang wa u yaw.
translation: That is your child and mine.

kac: Ngai hpawt de hkawm na.
eng: I will go to travel tomorrow.
translation: I am returning home.

kac: Gara de sa na rai?
translation: What will you do tomorrow?

kac: Manmaw de i?
translation: Are you in Bhamaw?

kac: N re. Myitkyina de sa na.
eng: No. I will go to Myitkyina.
translation: I want to go work in Myitkyina.

kac: Hpa hte sa na rai?
translation: Have you eaten today?

kac: Mawdaw hte i?
translation: Are you okay?

kac: Wan leng hte sa na.
translation: Eat fruits and meat.

kac: Wan leng lekmat ma mari ngut sai.
eng: I have already bought a train ticket.
translation: He/she is still buying books at the store.

kac: Kadai hte sa na rai?
translation: Who comes here with you?

kac: Manang hte i?
translation: How are you?

kac: Nu yen wa hte rau sa na.
eng: I am going with my parents.
translation: Come to the house, rest and eat.

kac: Ma La na kawa hpa bungli galaw ai rai?
eng: What does Ma La's father do?
translation: Did La sing a song at your friend's wedding?

kac: Jawng kaw sara galaw ai re.
eng: He works as a teacher in a school.
translation: Because of work, school is busy.

kac: Na nu gaw hpa galaw ai rai?
translation: Where does your mother want to go?

kac: Gat dut ai.
eng: She sells things at the market.
translation: This is fruit.

kac: Arung arai amyu myu dut ai re.
eng: She sells a lot of stuff.
translation: The tiger and the leopard are both big.

kac: Gara kaw dut ai rai?
translation: Who do you have?

kac: Hka makau na gat kata kaw re.
eng: At the market near the river.
translation: The water is very deep and difficult to cross.

kac: Anu na seng kaw masha grai sa ai re.
eng: Many people come to my mother's shop.
translation: Anu went to the market quickly.

kac: Ma La, nang kaw Japan laika buk nga ai i?
eng: Ma La, do you have a book about Japan?
translation: Mr. La, will you go to Japan?

kac: Nga ai.
translation: I go.

kac: Buk kade nga ai rai?
eng: How many books do you have?
translation: Which book do you want?

kac: Buk shi daram nga ai.
translation: There are five books.

kac: Grai law ai i.
translation: It is evident that he/she/it goes/has gone.

kac: Ngai kaw gaw langai sha nga ai.
translation: Now, I am going to work.

kac: Gara hku lu la ai rai?
translation: Did he/she finish eating rice?

kac: Manang langai Japan kaw na shagun ya ai.
eng: One of my friends sent it to me from Japan.
translation: He/She will go to Japan tomorrow.

kac: Nang hti mayu yang ngai ya shap ya na.
eng: I can lend it to you now if you want to read it.
translation: Will you speak with Mayu together with me?

kac: Ma Lu, dai ni gara de sa mayu ai rai?
eng: Ma Lu, where do you want to go today?
translation: Ma Lu, have you solved that difficult thing already?

kac: Ngai dai ni Manau wang de sa mayu ai.
eng: I want to go to Manau plaza today.
translation: I will really dance at the Manau festival today.

kac: Ndai kaw na mawdaw hte sa ra ai i?
eng: Do I need to go there by car?
translation: Did you understand and finish reading this book?

kac: Mawdaw hte n sa ra ai.
eng: You don't need to go by car.
translation: Mt. Mawdaw and I will eat together.

kac: Dai du hkra nau n tsan ai.
eng: It is not too far to get there.
translation: This place by the river is pleasant.

kac: Lam hkawm mai sa ai.
translation: The road is newly turning.

kac: Rai tim ya ngai lagaw machyi taw ai.
translation: When the sun rises, our house is almost black.

kac: Mawdaw hte mai sa na i?
translation: Do you want to buy a book and a pen?

kac: Mai sa ai.
translation: I can do it.

kac: Dai hku nga mawdaw hte sa ga.
translation: This person eats big fish and meat.

kac: Kade jaw ra na rai?
eng: How much do we have to pay?
translation: How many children does she have?

kac: Hkying lahkawng daram jaw ra ai.
eng: We have to pay about two thousand kyat.
translation: Life's path must be important.

kac: Kanau, ndai makau kaw lung seng dut ai seng nga ai i?
eng: Brother, is there a shop that sells jade near here?
translation: Mother, will we find peace of mind in this house?

kac: Nga ai le.
translation: I will eat rice.

kac: Ya lagaw leng pru wa ai shara na makau kaw nga ai.
eng: It is near the place where the bicycle came out just now.
translation: That girl with the book is a student I already know.

kac: Mu ai i?
translation: What are you doing?

kac: Um, mu sai, mu sai.
eng: Yes, I see it, I see it.
translation: Okay, still good, still good.

kac: Dai seng kaw lung seng lahkawn dut ai i?
eng: Does the shop sell a jade bracelet?
translation: Can this day feel strong and happy?

kac: Lung seng lahkawn kaba ra ai re.
eng: I want a big jade bracelet.
translation: The mountain is really high and beautiful.

kac: Wora seng kaw kaba ai n nga na ngu shadu ai.
eng: I think that shop does not have a big one.
translation: Wora is easy enough to speak, but I do not know it well.

kac: Kaji ai gaw nga na re.
eng: It surely has a small one.
translation: I, Kaji, see a fish.

kac: Re i?
translation: What is this?

kac: Hpa rai tim sa yu na re.
translation: Will you eat again after finishing your food?

kac: Chyeju kaba sai yaw.
translation: The tiger often roars.

kac: N ra ai law.
translation: I have already gone.

kac: Ma Naw tauba si la wa ya ai.
eng: Ma Naw brought us a gourd.
translation: I am going to look for a job with Naw.

kac: Tauba si hpe gara hku sha ai rai?
eng: How do you eat a gourd?
translation: Where is God going?

kac: Kawa sha ai baw i?
eng: Do you eat it by biting?
translation: How many times have you seen it?

kac: N re. Ahpyi sep na sha ai baw re.
eng: No, you eat it by peeling the skin.
translation: I am thinking about the morning, right?

kac: Tauba si gaw kangau sha yang grai mu ai.
translation: Last night, the moon was very clear.

kac: Sha mayu yang ya kangau ya na le.
eng: I can fry one for you if you want to eat it.
translation: My friend calls her younger female relative property.

kac: Kangau ngut sai.
translation: The young mountain goat ascended the tree.

kac: Chyim yu u le.
translation: Go eat rice now.

kac: Ndai hkri hpa hte kahtawk sha u.
eng: Please eat it with this dipping sauce.
translation: This day and at twelve o'clock AM.

kac: Gara hku rai?
translation: How many of you are there?

kac: Grai mu ai.
translation: The river is big.

kac: Ma Lu, nang Japan sa na wora kaw dut yang kaja ai.
eng: Ma Lu, you had better go to Japan and sell it there.
translation: Ma Lu, are you studying in Japan or not, perhaps?

kac: Grai lu dut na re.
translation: The dog intends to eat rice.

kac: Ngai hpe hkum sharawt tsun.
translation: I want to read the book.

kac: Ma, dai ni jawng n sa ai i?
eng: Child, don't you go to school today?
translation: Mother, are you working this year?

kac: Dai ni jawng pat ai majaw n sa ra ai.
eng: I don't have to go because the school is closed today.
translation: This work has been completed, but we have a new one.

kac: Awa ma rung n sa ai i?
eng: Dad, don't you go to the office?
translation: Is he not going to run again?
